title: Belgian Golfer Scores 14th Sub-60 Round in Korn Ferry Tour History
snippets: Adrien Dumont de Chassart of Belgium shot an 11-under 59 on Thursday in the Wichita Open for the 14 sub-60 round in Korn Ferry Tour history.  Dumont de Chassart had 12 birdies and a bogey in the morning round at storm-damaged Crestview Country Club, with players allowed to lift, clean and place their golf balls in the fairways because of wet conditions.  “Honestly, with all the rain and storms that they got, I thought the course was in really good shape,” Dumont de Chassart said.
titles: Adrien Dumont de Chassart shoots 59 in Wichita Open for 14th sub-60 round in Korn Ferry Tour history
summary: Adrien Dumont de Chassart from Belgium scored an 11-under 59 at the Wichita Open, marking the 14th sub-60 round in Korn Ferry Tour history. During the event, held at the storm-damaged Crestview Country Club, Dumont de Chassart achieved 12 birdies and one bogey. The tournament allowed players to lift, clean, and place their balls due to wet conditions, which Dumont de Chassart acknowledged, praising the course's condition despite the weather challenges.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information and context about a significant achievement in golf. It details the player's performance, the conditions of the tournament, and the player's response to these conditions. However, it does not clearly highlight any progress, solutions, or empowering knowledge.
